cities.name: New York
cities.context: This city was the first capital of the United States after the Constitution was ratified in 1788.

cities.name: Los Angeles
cities.context: This is the only North American city to host the olympics twice.

cities.name: Chicago
cities.context: This city is home to the world's tallest building designed by a female.

cities.name: San Francisco
cities.context: The United Nations Charter was drafted and ratified in 1945 in this city.

cities.name: Portland
cities.context: This city is home to world's smallest park.

cities.name: Los Vegas
cities.context: This city is host to the United States' largest bronze statue.

cities.name: Atlanta
cities.context: This city is the only city in North America to have been destroyed as an act of war.

cities.name: Miami
cities.context: The largest collection of Art Deco architecture in the US is in this city.

cities.name: Honolulu
cities.context: This city is home to the only royal palace in the U.S.

cities.name: Orlando
cities.context: This city was the most visited city in the world in 2015.
